doc.title: Silvio Berlusconi villa flights investigation dropped
doc.author: Associated Press; Guardian staff reporter
doc.description: Prosecutors cease inquiry into allegations that Italy's prime minister misused government planes

main.p: Prosecutors are to drop their investigation into allegations that Italy's prime minister, Silvio Berlusconi, misused government planes to fly entertainers and starlets to his holiday villa on Sardinia. Investigation of six flights found no wrongdoing and no additional costs to the state, the Ansa and Apcom news agencies said. The opposition "has come up with nothing after making insinuations of every type," said Daniele Capezzone, spokesman for Berlusconi's Freedom People party. A special tribunal considering allegations against government officials must now decide whether to order further investigation.
main.head: Silvio Berlusconi villa flights investigation dropped
